summary: This is an internal email from the Chief of the Public Corruption Unit at the SDNY, requesting detailed briefing memos on Jeffrey Epstein by the next day, with a plan to forward them by Thursday morning. It indicates active preparation and coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the Epstein case in February 2019.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: The email is addressed to Geoffrey Berman, indicating he is the recipient of the briefing memo request regarding the Epstein case.

events.title: Request for Epstein Briefing Memos
events.description: The Chief of the Public Corruption Unit at the SDNY emails U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman, stating that teams have been asked to prepare detailed briefing memos on Jeffrey Epstein by the following day (Feb 20), with a plan to turn them over by Thursday morning (Feb 21).

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY (United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively preparing briefing materials on Jeffrey Epstein in February 2019.
The email is from the Chief of the Public Corruption Unit, indicating that unit's involvement in the Epstein matter.
The communication shows internal coordination and urgency, with a request for memos by the next day.
The email is addressed to then-U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman, placing him in the chain of information regarding the case.
